statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Stephon Jelks scored 24 points with 17 rebounds -- both career highs -- and Mercer beat The Citadel 91-80 on Saturday for the Bulldogs' fifth straight loss.
article.headline: Mercer beats The Citadel 91-80 behind Jelks' career day
article.linkText: Mercer beats The Citadel 91-80 behind Jelks' career day
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Stephon Jelks scored 24 points with 17 rebounds -- both career highs -- and Mercer beat The Citadel 91-80 on Saturday for the Bulldogs' fifth straight loss. Jordan Strawberry scored 19 points, Demetre Rivers added 17 with three 3-pointers -- both career highs -, Phillip Leonard had 14, and Jestin Lewis 10 for the Bears (12-4, 2-1 Southern Conference). Mercer outrebounded The Citadel 51-28 and held the Bulldogs well below their per-game average of 90.2 points. Trailing by 12 at halftime, the Bulldogs gained on a 9-0 run in which P.J. Boutte and Brian White each hit 3s, but the Bears pulled away on a 12-3 run in which Strawberry scored seven. The Citadel hit four straight 3-pointers to close within 65-58 with 8:29 left, then made three straight with 22 seconds to go. Connor Schroeder scored 14 points, Boutte 13 and Quayson Williams 11 for the Bulldogs (7-9, 0-3), who hit 16 of 43 3-pointers.
